result.execSummary:
The defendant Mandy L Kenyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mandy L Kenyon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mandy L Kenyon was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DEFENDANT IS NOT TO CONSUME OR POSSESS ALCOHOL.  DO NOT ENTER PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS PRIMARY BUSINESS, ANY BARS TAVERNS OR LIQUOR STORES.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mandy L Kenyon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharge-regular
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.  Probation will be extended for 6 months to 7/12/17 to allow for completion of treatment programming as an Alternative to Revocation at Affinity House.

Defendant Mandy L Kenyon in court with attorney Lauren Olivia Otto.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 13CF171, 13CF175, 14CF25.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter plea of NC to Ct 1 in 13CF156, Ct 1 in 13CF171, Ct 1 in 14CF25.  DE will waive PSI.  Counts 2, 3 in 13CF156 will be dismissed, Ct's 2 and 3 in 14CF25 will be dismissed, 13CF175 will be dismissed but read in.  Has credit for 78 days, credit will be applied to OWI charge.  
13CF156-DE will serve 165 days jail, 30 month revoc of DL, 30 month IID, will pay restitution of $22.90, fine of $2519.00, DE will have huber, 50% reduction in installation/maintenance of IID. Will report to jail today.
13CF156-Ct1, NC plea, withhold sentence 2 yrs probation, no alcohol possession or consumption, do not be present where alcohol is the primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores.  Will pay CC. 

14CF25-Ct 1-NC plea, withhold sentence 2 yrs probation, no alcohol etc,  will pay CC
